quest.name: It Was a Very Good Year
journal: Shamani Lohmani is brimming with glee, and he wishes to share the reason why with you.

Shamani Lohmani has determined that the leaves Drest used to seal his palm wine coconut shells are none other than those of the legendary Bacchus grape vine. Eager to confirm his assertions, he bids you take one of the leaves back to Drest and press him for more information.

Drest had no idea that the leaves were so rare, and he states that he found them near the crashed juggernaut to the south of the Severed String. He did not see any grape-bearing vines in the region, but he did notice fresh goobbue tracks, which leads him to believe that the Bacchus vines may be growing on the back of a wandering goobbue. Search for the goobbue near the juggernaut, but be prepared to defend yourself if the creature turns hostile.

Having encroached upon the goobbue's territory, you have no choice but to slay it. Fortunately, as Drest suspected, the beast was indeed the source of the Bacchus leaves. Having collected a pristine cutting of the grape vine, you may now return to Wineport and present it to Shamani Lohmani.

Moments after Shamani Lohmani confirms that you have brought him a cutting of Bacchus vine, Byrglaent storms outside to see the truth for himself. He confirms Shamani Lohmani's claim, and is subsequently shocked by the blind vintner's decision to give him the Bacchus cutting free of charge. Moved by Shamani Lohmani's simple desire to see the Bacchus vineyards restored to their former glory, Byrglaent bequeaths to him a bottle of 1547 Bacchus, arguably the finest wine ever produced. Having at last obtained a suitable wine for Master Gegeruju's banquet, the blind vintner entrusts the bottle to you, and bids you deliver it to Wheiskaet at Costa del Sol.

Wheiskaet is not ignorant of your wine's stellar reputation, and he declares that this will be the most luxurious feast Costa del Sol has seen in years. He declares that since both guests are now present, the banquet can be held as planned. Noting your confusion, he suggests that you speak with the scholarly associate seated on the bench nearby.
objectives: Show the Bacchus leaf to Drest.
Search for the goobbue near the juggernaut.
Deliver the Bacchus cutting to Shamani Lohmani.
Deliver the Bacchus wine to Wheiskaet.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: By the gods... Forename, listen! I know you're eager to wash your hands of this wine business, but I've just discovered something extraordinary about Drest's palm wine!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: He sealed each coconut shell with a leaf─a leaf which has a very distinct shape and unusual odor. I thought I was going mad at first, but now I'm certain: these are the leaves of a Bacchus grape vine!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Do you know what this means? Somewhere in Raincatcher Gully, the legendary vine still grows! If we could obtain a cutting, we could revive the Bacchus wine industry!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: We must know where Drest found these leaves! Here, take one of them back to him and see what he remembers!

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: Oh...hello again. What is it?

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: It's...it's just a leaf, isn't it? I only chose it because it was pretty. Didn't know it was rare...

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I found them near the juggernaut to the south. But...I didn't see any grape vines.

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: I saw fresh goobbue tracks, though. Maybe...maybe the leaves came from vines growing on the back of one such beast?

dialogue.name: DREST
dialogue.text: If...if you go looking for it, please be careful. Some goobbues are more territorial than others, and you may have to defend yourself.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: What did Drest have to say, Forename? Tell me everything!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Ahaha, I was right! This smell, this texture... I hold in my hands a Bacchus grape vine cutting!

dialogue.name: BYRGLAENT
dialogue.text: Come now, enough of this nonsense! I've heard talk of your discovery, and I refuse to believe that a common adventurer and a novice vintner could─

dialogue.name: BYRGLAENT
dialogue.text: Twelve as my witness, it is a Bacchus grape vine! Where ever did you find this fantastic specimen!?

dialogue.name: BYRGLAENT
dialogue.text: Wh-What...? You would offer this to me? But why!?

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: There is none better positioned to reconstruct the Bacchus vineyards than you, Master Byrglaent. You have the resources, the knowledge, and the passion to do so. It would be selfish of me to keep this cutting.

dialogue.name: BYRGLAENT
dialogue.text: I never knew you cared so deeply about your craft. Thank you, good sir. I will not squander this gift! In just a few years' time, I swear that every tavern across Eorzea will once again be clamoring for a cask of Wineport's legendary Bacchus wine!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Sir, you needn't─ <sniff> <sniff> Wait! The shape of this bottle, the scent of this label... This couldn't possibly be...

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: A 1547 Bacchus!? But that's impossible! This vintage has not been seen since years before the Calamity!

dialogue.name: BYRGLAENT
dialogue.text: It was the crown jewel of my personal collection. For years, I debated opening it, wondering if today or tomorrow would be the ideal time. But now I realize that it was never meant for me─it should be savored by the saviors of Wineport, I say!

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: He has made us an offer we cannot refuse. Master Gegeruju will find no finer wine.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: You have forever changed Wineport, Forename. Thank you for your kindness and your generosity.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Ah, but do not permit me to delay you any longer. Pray deliver the wine to Captain Wheiskaet.

dialogue.name: SHAMANILOHMANI
dialogue.text: Hm? Well, yes, I would very much like to drink it! But I am a patient man. I have faith that one day I shall have another opportunity to taste perfection.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Your prolonged absence was beginning to concern me. So, what of the wine I asked you to bring?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Is that...? Seven hells, a 1547 Bacchus! Even I know how rare that is!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I have to admit, I didn't think you had it in you... But congratulations, Forename. Thanks to you, this will be the most luxurious feast Costa del Sol has seen in years.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Considering the lengths you went to, I hope our guests appreciate it.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, your associate arrived a short while ago. She appears to be growing somewhat impatient.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Perhaps you could tell her that the banquet is about to begin?

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: Ripples in the water catch your eye...
